trans-unit.source: Create custom DNS records for a Web app | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Create custom DNS records for a Web app | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: How to create custom domain DNS records for Web app using Azure DNS. Step by step to verify your domain ownership using CNAME or A record
trans-unit.target: How to create custom domain DNS records for Web app using Azure DNS. Step by step to verify your domain ownership using CNAME or A record

trans-unit.source: Create DNS records for Web app in a custom domain
trans-unit.target: Create DNS records for Web app in a custom domain

trans-unit.source: You can use Azure DNS to host a custom domain for your web apps.
trans-unit.target: You can use Azure DNS to host a custom domain for your web apps.

trans-unit.source: For instance, imagine that you are creating an Azure web app and want your users to acces it by either using contoso.com or www.contoso.com as a FQDN.
trans-unit.target: For instance, imagine that you are creating an Azure web app and want your users to acces it by either using contoso.com or www.contoso.com as a FQDN.

trans-unit.source: In this scenario, you would have to create two records: a root A record pointing to contoso.com, and a CNAME record for the www name, pointing to the A record.
trans-unit.target: In this scenario, you would have to create two records: a root A record pointing to contoso.com, and a CNAME record for the www name, pointing to the A record.

trans-unit.source: Keep in mind that if you create an A record for a web app in Azure, the A record must be manually updated if the underlying IP address for the web app changes.
trans-unit.target: Keep in mind that if you create an A record for a web app in Azure, the A record must be manually updated if the underlying IP address for the web app changes.

trans-unit.source: Before you can create records for your custom domain, you must create a DNS zone in Azure DNS, and delegate the zone in your registrar to Azure DNS.
trans-unit.target: Before you can create records for your custom domain, you must create a DNS zone in Azure DNS, and delegate the zone in your registrar to Azure DNS.

trans-unit.source: To create a DNS zone, follow the steps in <link><linkText>Get started with Azure DNS</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To create a DNS zone, follow the steps in <link><linkText>Get started with Azure DNS</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To delegate your DNS to Azure DNS, follow the steps in <link><linkText>Delegate Domain to Azure DNS</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To delegate your DNS to Azure DNS, follow the steps in <link><linkText>Delegate Domain to Azure DNS</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Create an A record for your custom domain
trans-unit.target: Create an A record for your custom domain

trans-unit.source: An A record is used to map a name to its IP address.
trans-unit.target: An A record is used to map a name to its IP address.

trans-unit.source: In the following example we will assign @ as an A record to an IPv4 address:
trans-unit.target: In the following example we will assign @ as an A record to an IPv4 address:

trans-unit.source: Step 1
trans-unit.target: Step 1

trans-unit.source: Create an A record and assign to a variable $rs
trans-unit.target: Create an A record and assign to a variable $rs

trans-unit.source: Step 2
trans-unit.target: Step 2

trans-unit.source: Add IPv4 value to previously created record set "@" using the $rs variable assigned.
trans-unit.target: Add IPv4 value to previously created record set "@" using the $rs variable assigned.

trans-unit.source: The IPv4 value assigned will be the IP address for your web app.
trans-unit.target: The IPv4 value assigned will be the IP address for your web app.

trans-unit.source: To find the IP address for a web app, follow the steps in <link><linkText>Configure a custom domain name in Azure App Service</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: To find the IP address for a web app, follow the steps in <link><linkText>Configure a custom domain name in Azure App Service</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Step 3
trans-unit.target: Step 3

trans-unit.source: Commit the changes to the record set.
trans-unit.target: Commit the changes to the record set.

trans-unit.source: Use Set-AzureDnsRecordSet to upload the changes to the record set to Azure DNS:
trans-unit.target: Use Set-AzureDnsRecordSet to upload the changes to the record set to Azure DNS:

trans-unit.source: Creating a CNAME record for your custom domain
trans-unit.target: Creating a CNAME record for your custom domain

trans-unit.source: Assuming your domain is already managed by Azure DNS (see <link><linkText>DNS domain delegation</linkText><title></title></link>, you can use the following the example to create a CNAME record for contoso.azurewebsites.net:
trans-unit.target: Assuming your domain is already managed by Azure DNS (see <link><linkText>DNS domain delegation</linkText><title></title></link>, you can use the following the example to create a CNAME record for contoso.azurewebsites.net:

trans-unit.source: Step 1
trans-unit.target: Step 1

trans-unit.source: Open powershell and create a new CNAME record set and assign to a variable $rs:
trans-unit.target: Open powershell and create a new CNAME record set and assign to a variable $rs:

trans-unit.source: This will create a record set type CNAME with a "time to live" of 600 seconds in DNS zone named "contoso.com".
trans-unit.target: This will create a record set type CNAME with a "time to live" of 600 seconds in DNS zone named "contoso.com".

trans-unit.source: Step 2
trans-unit.target: Step 2

trans-unit.source: Once the CNAME record set is created, you need to create an alias value which will point to the web app.
trans-unit.target: Once the CNAME record set is created, you need to create an alias value which will point to the web app.

trans-unit.source: Using the previously assigned variable "$rs" you can use the PowerShell command below to create the alias for the web app contoso.azurewebsites.net.
trans-unit.target: Using the previously assigned variable "$rs" you can use the PowerShell command below to create the alias for the web app contoso.azurewebsites.net.

trans-unit.source: Step 3
trans-unit.target: Step 3

trans-unit.source: Commit the changes using the Set-AzureDnsRecordSet cmdlet:
trans-unit.target: Commit the changes using the Set-AzureDnsRecordSet cmdlet:

trans-unit.source: You can validate the record was created correctly by querying the "www.contoso.com" using nslookup, as shown below:
trans-unit.target: You can validate the record was created correctly by querying the "www.contoso.com" using nslookup, as shown below:

trans-unit.source: Create an awverify record for Web apps (A records only)
trans-unit.target: Create an awverify record for Web apps (A records only)

trans-unit.source: If you decide to use an A record for your web app, you must go through a verification process to allow Azure to ensure you own the custom domain.
trans-unit.target: If you decide to use an A record for your web app, you must go through a verification process to allow Azure to ensure you own the custom domain.

trans-unit.source: This verification step is done by creating a special CNAME record named "awverify".
trans-unit.target: This verification step is done by creating a special CNAME record named "awverify".

trans-unit.source: In the example below, the "awverify" record will be created for contoso.com to verify ownership for the custom domain:
trans-unit.target: In the example below, the "awverify" record will be created for contoso.com to verify ownership for the custom domain:

trans-unit.source: Step 1
trans-unit.target: Step 1

trans-unit.source: Step 2
trans-unit.target: Step 2

trans-unit.source: Once the record set awverify is created, you have to assign the CNAME record set alias to awverify.contoso.azurewebsites.net, as shown in the command below:
trans-unit.target: Once the record set awverify is created, you have to assign the CNAME record set alias to awverify.contoso.azurewebsites.net, as shown in the command below:

trans-unit.source: Step 3
trans-unit.target: Step 3

trans-unit.source: Commit the changes using the Set-AzureDnsRecordSet cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: Commit the changes using the Set-AzureDnsRecordSet cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: as shown in the command below:
trans-unit.target: as shown in the command below:

trans-unit.source: Now you can continue to follow the steps in <link><linkText>Configuring a custom domain name for App Service</linkText><title></title></link> to configure your web app to use a custom domain.
trans-unit.target: Now you can continue to follow the steps in <link><linkText>Configuring a custom domain name for App Service</linkText><title></title></link> to configure your web app to use a custom domain.
